name: Barbecued Prawns with Lemon Garlic Butter
ingredients: 1 kg large raw prawns, peeled and deveined
instructions: Preheat a barbecue grill to high heat.
In a small bowl, combine garlic, melted butter, lemon juice, chopped parsley, salt, and black pepper.
Thread prawns onto skewers and brush with the garlic butter mixture.
Place prawn skewers on the barbecue grill and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until pink and cooked through.
Serve hot with lemon wedges and additional garlic butter on the side.

name: Beef and Guinness Stew
ingredients: 2 lbs stewing beef, cut into 1-inch cubes
Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F.
In a large bowl, toss beef cubes with flour until well coated.
Heat vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add beef cubes and cook until browned on all sides.
Add onion, garlic, carrots, and celery, and cook for 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Stir in tomato paste, beef broth, Guinness beer, Worcestershire sauce, bay leaves, thyme, salt, and black pepper.
Bring to a simmer, then cover and transfer to the preheated oven.
Bake for 2-3 hours or until beef is tender.
Serve hot with mashed potatoes and steamed green beans.

name: Anzac Biscuits
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine flour, rolled oats, desiccated coconut, and granulated sugar.
In a small saucepan, melt unsalted butter and golden syrup over low heat.
In a small bowl, dissolve baking soda in boiling water, then add to the butter mixture.
Add the butter mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until well combined.
Roll tablespoons of the mixture into balls and place them on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them 2 inches apart.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serve with a cup of tea or coffee.
